greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Sum_{k=0..n} (-1)^(n-k)*binomial(n-1,k-1)*n^k*n!/k!.
comment: a(n) is the n-th term of the inverse Lah transform of the powers of n.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..400
Index entries for sequences related to Laguerre polynomials
formula: a(n) = (-1)^(n+1) * n * n! * Hypergeometric1F1([1-n], [2], n) with a(0) = 1.
a(n) = (-1)^(n+1) * n! * LaguerreL(n-1, 1, n) with a(0) = 1. - _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 09 2021
mathematica: Join[{1}, Table[Sum[(-1)^(n-k) Binomial[n-1, k-1] n^k n!/k!, {k, n}], {n, 22}]]
Join[{1}, Table[(-1)^(n+1) n n! Hypergeometric1F1[1-n, 2, n], {n, 22}]]
program: (Sage) [1]+[(-1)^(n+1)*factorial(n)*gen_laguerre(n-1,1,n) for n in (1..30)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 09 2021
l:= func< n, a, b | Evaluate(LaguerrePolynomial(n, a), b) >;
results.author: _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Jul 25 2018
